com.aspire.controller

Class AccountController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aspire.controller.AccountController

  • @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/accounts")
public class AccountController
extends java.lang.Object
    End point which controls all requests which are related to account. Account controller will call appropriate service and get the result back as response. Response will have response code, message if something has to be return back and requested result set.
    Author:
    faizal.arafath

      • activate

        @RequestMapping(value="/activate/{accountId}",
                method=PUT)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> activate(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                   java.lang.String accountId)
        Method to activate the account. Usually activation URL will be called from account activation mail.

        Returns:
        ResponseEntity of type BaseResponse

      • update

        @RequestMapping(method=PUT)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> update(@RequestBody
                                                                                                 AccountDto request)
        This method is used to update the account informations. For now API has ability to update only the account balance. All other information like account name, account id cannot be changed once created.
        Parameters:
        request -
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity of type BaseResponse

      • fetch

        @RequestMapping(value="/{accountId}",
                method=GET)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<AccountDto> fetch(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                     java.lang.String accountId)
        Method to fetch account information. It require accountId to be passed. This method is also capable of returning all associated transactions details for the account. For now only the skeleton has been made and transaction will not be return back to the response.
        Parameters:
        accountId -
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity of type AccountDto

      • delete

        @RequestMapping(value="/delete/{accountId}",
                method=DELETE)
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<BaseResponse> delete(@PathVariable
                                                                                                                                                  java.lang.String accountId)
        Method to delete the account. It requires account id to be passed. Once the account is deleted user will be able to transfer or view account details.
        Parameters:
        accountId -
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity of type BaseResponse
